intro: Pawia mexicana, commonly known as the Mexican pawia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and other similar species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, trumpet-shaped flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
